author: makortel
body:
This PR adds pixel pair iteration to phase1 tracking for
- backup for triplets in the barrel-forward transition not covered by 4 layers (as in #17891 for phase 2)
- mitigation for the region currently covered only by two active barrel layers
  * seeding from layers BPix1+BPix4

In order to keep fakes and timing under control, the regions are restricted to first 5 `firstStepPrimaryVertices`. As a knock-on effect, `firstStepPrimaryVertices` are now sorted (similar to `offlnePrimaryVertices`). The sorting will likely cause tiny, numerical-level effect on phase0 tracking.

MTV plots for phase1 ttbar+PU35 are here
https://cms-tracking-validation.web.cern.ch/cms-tracking-validation/PR/CMSSW_9_1_0_pre3_PR19051/
comparing 910pre3 out of the box (all modules active), recent pixel bad module map, pixelPair iteration w/o the mitigation part, and the full PR.

Tested in 9_1_0_pre3 and CMSSW_9_2_X_2017-05-30-1100. Expecting changes as shown above in phase1, numerical-level changes on phase0 (caused by sorting `firstStepPrimaryVertices`), and no effect on phase2.

@rovere @VinInn @mtosi @JanFSchulte
title: Mitigation for inactive pixel regions for phase1 tracking
